title: I made a new account to experience League Of Legends all over again
body:
As I was playing the young noob, I experienced the following IN GAME:
 
*  People who auto lock and call each other names
*  People who tell others they suck and should quit league of legends
*  People who threaten to report you for "feeding" when you're just trying to learn a champion fully.
*  A LOT of afkers and people who d.c because they got either bored or fed the enemy.
*  A lot of so called " smurfs from Diamond elo " who enjoy putting people down.

Outside of the game [Meaning the shop, EXP, and IP] I experienced the following:

*  Leveling takes long but its RIGHT for people who never played the game.
*  IP rewards are unfair and takes SUPER long to save up. 
*  Runes and Rune pages are extremely pricey, it's hard to reach the rank requirements quickly due to pricey things.
*  Winning gives you x2 IP/EXP than losing but it's hard to win when you have AFK'ers and EXTREMELY rude people.

Conclusion:

Leveling and Saving is hell and people are dicks :l

> Outside of the game [Meaning the shop, EXP, and IP] I experienced the following:

> *  Leveling takes long but its RIGHT for people who never played the game.

Agreed. I do think they could make improvements though, like removing summoner level in favor of champion mastery score.

Note that if you buy both the per-win XP boost and per-day XP boost at the same time (and then play a lot to make full use of it), it goes WAY faster.

This whole genre is bad for newcomers, but League seems to introduce as many mechanics as possible to make it truly awful for someone trying to learn the game.
I'd show examples of the things I see in chat but I'm sure most know.
How does league introduce as many mechanics as possible, when Dota 2 has more going on?

> [{quoted}](name=Silents429,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MQpaIqeX,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2015-12-22T22:04:46.816+0000)
>
> How does league introduce as many mechanics as possible, when Dota 2 has more going on?

Mechanics in the client, not within game.

Runes and masteries (especially the new keystone masteries, thunderlord's decree vs someone without any of the keystones just isn't fair) giving you a statistical disadvantage from the loading screen, tiny number of playable champs that changes every week so you may not have any champs you like in a given week, don't have time to learn one you do like before they're gone, and can't properly learn about other champs you've played against without watching the rotation for 4 months or longer, the long grind for xp and/or ip to rectify any of those problems...

The total lack of quality custom game settings, tutorials, useful in-game information, first party replays and bots, the completely neglected chat rooms where players could try to find advice or players of equal experience to enjoy the game with, the fact that even if they DID have a more experienced friend to play with, runes and masteries make playing against them come down to "well you have keystones and I don't so I lose the game regardless of how well I know it" and playing with them ends up being "i get wrecked by more experienced players matched at the average of our MMR and it's power hour for you so we just hope you can carry a 1v5"

It's really bad.
That's nice suggestions, hope Riot will see them.

I just did the same thing recently and experienced exactly what you've described. If every new player goes through this I doubt there will be many sticking around for the abuse. I suggest more harsh penalties for rule breakers and toxic hateful people. Also, yes I think the prices could use a little adjustment as it took my over 150 games to save around 22,000 IP and it was gone in 2 rune pages with not even enough to purchase another cheap champion.

You're only being matched with other smurfs, very few actual noobs.  The system is designed to weed out smurfs like you from actual new players because it used to be way worse.

IP gains are still idiotic, but that's half of your issues explained.

My level 12 account has gone 11 games in a row and counting with either a troll or afker on my team, 5 of which having 2 or more trolls/afkers. Lower levels are absolutely hellish, especially since I don't even have the option of trying out new champions due to the ridiculous ip costs and lack of masteries for jungling properly.

My biggest problem with it all is the IP gains.  That shit is a scam to force you to buy RP to play new champs and buy IP boost for runes.  Not to mention runes are the biggest scam/trap for new players.  The first 2 tiers of runes are such a waste or both time/IP that at this point riot seems to be scamming new players by leaving them in the game.
I did the same thing and then I realized, I got my ass carried to Silver and I actually belong in Bronze :p
I don't see "influence points" very influencing.

*reads title*
*aggressively cringes*

It was so unreal...I though i was dreaming."

When i run into toxic little snots...i be like "oh look...another little shit with an attitude hiding behind his monitor.......yay.   [  _~~MUTE~~_ ]{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

I feel like League should do what smite does. Have tutorials until you are level 5, level up rewards like free champ/god for a limited time, exp boosts and free favor/ip.

Everyone plays to win, technically, just some people only want to win and not enjoy the game.

That would be my thought on it, anyway.
I didn't have to make a smurf account to know that.

Once you buy them, they are bought, on my main account, I have nothing I can do with IP. I have like 80k or so, and I main ranked, so it doesn't come buy all to easy.

Pretty much exactly it.  This game is disgusting when looked at as a whole, but that is almost entirely because of the player base and how they treat others.  For whatever reason this game has the most toxicity I have ever witnessed in one place.

When you create a smurf the system correlates and figures out who your main is based on your login credentials and point of access. Then after the game gives you your "rating" after you hit the required level for player matches, the system will automatically place you in a "rating" with other like minded people who think smurfing is in any way beneficial or fun.

That is why the "White Knights" of the Boards (AKA : player who do the same as you, "test" the "noob" experience) have shit experiences and then come complain on these boards about it.


System's working as intended, and if you were actually a brand new player chances are your game quality will be a little better. You'll still have feeders and dcers, afkers too. Because this is League of Legends, and it happens at all levels of play. :)
